description.narrative: The Proposed Project Development Objective (PDO) is to improve transport mobility in the central city of Changzhi in a safe, energy-saving, and efficient manner for all users.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Implementation organizational structure Description :Shanxi Province and Changzhi Municipality shall maintainan adequate organizational structure for the implementation of the project. Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :Mid-term progress reportDescription :Shanxi Province shall cause Changzhi Municipality to furnish to the Bank amid-term progress report for the project.Due Date :30-Jun-2014

Finance Agreement :Project reportsDescription :Shanxi Province shall cause Changzhi Municipality to furnish to the Banksemi-annual project reports to monitor and evaluate progress in project implementation. Frequency :SemiAnnual
Finance Agreement :Safeguards implementation Description :Shanxi Province shall cause Changzhi Municipality to implement the RPFand EMP. Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Safeguards implementation reports Description :Shanxi Province shall cause Changzhi Municipality to furnish tothe Bank semi-annual progress reports on the implementation of RFP and EMP. Frequency :SemiAnnual

title.narrative: Institutional Capacity Development: Number of technical studies completed.
Intelligent Urban Transport Management System: Number of upgraded signalized junctions and mid-block signalized crossings.
Public Transport Infrastructure: Number of depots built
Inegrated Corridor Improvement: Number of kilometers of bus priority lanes built.
Integrated Corridor Improvement: Number of kilometers of existing corridors that are upgraded with improved non-motorized transportand accessibility facilities.
Intelligent Urban Transport Management System: Number of e-police cameras procured and installed.
average AM peak hour public transit travel speeds in project corridors increased
Average fuel consumption per passenger-km on project corridor
Average annual number of traffic accident fatalities in the project corridors over a three-year period reduced
Public Transit User Satisfaction Survey (% respondents "satisfied" or more) (relative to base year)
Institutional Capacity Development: Completion of travel demand model and training.
